treatment.description: Herbs, annual. Stems erect or straggling, 0.5–1 m, glabrous. Leaves: petiole elongate, to 6 cm; blade unlobed, lanceolate or ovate, to 3–11 × 1–6 cm, base tapering, apex acuminate. Inflorescences interrupted, lax spikelike panicles, units less than 10 mm diam. Flowers: tepals silvery, whitish, or tannish, 1-veined, ovate, 2–3 mm, membranous, margins faintly erose, apex rounded-acute; style 0.2 mm; stigmas 3. Utricles 3–3.5 mm. Seeds 4–8, 0.7–1 mm diam., faintly reticulate. 2n = 18.
treatment.discussion: According to R. P. Wunderlin (1979), Celosia trigyna is an occasional weed introduced from tropical Africa.
